review: Been here a lot of times they don't always get my order right. because I order a medium rare steak, but customer service is always been a really good they always take of it.

The food is mediocre, the alcoholic beverages I've had aren't that great - more of some type of juice than any kind of Long Island iced tea or anything. Prices are fair. Can't complain but I just don't enjoy the atmosphere or the location.

I was extremely impressed when my friends and family all went after church tonight. We descended on Applebee's with over 40 people and they had us all seated within 10 minutes.  The manager was very efficient and had us seated close enough to communicate, though they didn't have the resources to seat us all together. The food was better than I remembered, and despite the chaos we brought the wait staff did an excellent job and remained friendly and helpful. Kudos to you Applebees, we'll try to give you more warning next time.

Started off being quickly seated however the first table suggested was dirty with leftover food still on the table despite the table being set up for a new group. We requested a different table.  Our water and lemonade were quickly delivered, order taken in time, appetizer in time and food also arrived in timely manner. Next came several problems.  We waited FIFTEEN MINUTES for a refill on my daughters lemonade (we had placed the empty glass in plain sight at edge of table) so she had nothing to drink with her food. We pushed the " call server" button then waited another 6 minutes before a woman who appeared to be a hostess who stated she had no idea where our server was but that she would let the manager know.  I informed her that we would like boxes to go as well as a lemonade to go since we had not gotten any refill after waiting. We gave the tip to this woman as she was the only one who took the time to check on us after 16 minutes of waiting.  A gentleman from the table seated close to us literally had to get up and walk over to the hostess station to request a glass of water for his wife because they also had been waiting a very long time. ( with their call server light as well on).  Our server just disappeared without even apparently the hostess knowing where he was. As far as the manager being told......we never spoke with a manager and they made no effort to come speak with us. We just got out boxes paid the bill and left.  Being served food then nothing to drink and ignoring customers for 16 minutes even after having the "call server" button pushed (on other tables as well) is absolute terrible service in my opinion.

Came here for my Birthday lunch with my mom.  We got the 2 for $20 special and both decided on the Oriental Chicken Salad.  It was Excellent!  I don't get salad very often at most places but this was well worth it.  The service was excellent.  Since it was my birthday I got a coupon for a free dessert and I got the Triple Chocolate something and it was fantastic.  I practically licked the plate (at least I really wanted to!).

I can agree with the majority about the staff; they are nice, food was alright too.  Suggestion: If just 2 people dining here together, eat at the bar or possible, get a booth. The 2 person tables I found awkwardly close, (literally could reach over and pick off your plate close).  My 4 rating is more for the staff, the food was okay.
More dirty tables than clean, potential customers leaving rather than praying for service that is better than the condition of the resturant.

We chose dinners from the 2 4 25 menu.My husband got a steak dinner,lncluded broccoli,and other veg& a choice of potatoes.I chose  bourbon chix &shrimp,no option with sides,I didnt know the sides!,I got horrible salty chix,very gritty shrimp,slimy onions also burnt potatoes wedges,no choice on sides,the cook came out and asked my husband if his steak was fine,even the server asked him,I ate what I could stomach,the server wanted to get me a take home tray,I said no.I will never go to Applebee's again,
My first time at apple bee's  it will be my last ..food was ok the food we actually got anyway. ..wait staff was bad very bad...for the money we spent very very disappointed. ...

Great food, great service, great prices.  Great place to dine!!  I am a veteran and appreciate the service a veteran receives on Veteran's day.  Not interested in the free food, am interested in their show of respect for men and women who have served.  Keep up the good work!!

I get roped into going here every once in a while and each time I leave I tell myself I will never go again. The only thing I like to eat here is the French Onion Soup. Otherwise I really think everything on the menu tastes awful.

Me and mom went to early dinner yesturday. Wasn't that busy when we got there asked to be seated at a table and I guess we were in a section that no one wanted 4 waitress walked by and said nothing after about 10 minutes . Was getting ready to leave and Micheal came from his section to help us he took   of us. Thank you Micheal. He deserves a raise excellent customer service. As far as the food my salad was good but mom's fish and chips made her stomach hurt.
We were there last night. Service was fine, but it took 45 minutes to get our food. Not what you expect from Applebee's. We finally just had to take it to go.
Ordered the new burgers. Took a bite and they had cooked the cheese paper in my burger. My husband ordered his well done it came with a bloody plate and bloody burger. Manager did nothing.

I hate coming to this location and now I will never go back.  One, it was freezing in there! I am always hot so the fact that I left my jacket on the whole time shows it must've been COLD.  Two, Our waitress, Deborah D, was horrible. She came to our table to bring us drinks and take our order, and that's pretty much it, someone else brought out our food and refilled our drinks because I told them our waitress vanished. Every, Single, Time, she walked by she made no eye contact whatsoever, had nothing in her hands, and pretty much just ran from one side of the restaurant to the other ignoring us completely. The two times she did actually come to our table she came dancing toward us ridiculously, and didn't even stay long enough to let us accomplish anything.  Three, My food was cold and I was never able to flag her down to tell her, I asked her for mustard and ranch which I never got. I didn't eat a single bite of my food which she didnt even ask about as she dropped the check and left before I could say anything again.  And lastly.... just to add even though its silly... we should've recieved 6cents change back, and she only brought 5cents. Like I said, silly... but the truth. She could've said "I ran out of pennies or something" but she didn't. She dropped the receipt and nickle and continued to run around doing NOTHING, but trying to look busy. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.. unless driving to the one off Parkway by Keizer is an option.

Always pleased with this Applebees location. It is clean and service is great. I come to this location often with friends. Tonight I warned the hostess my order might be "needy", which I KNOW are words of death to servers and hosts and kitchen alike (I am on a restrictive diet). She let the server know and he promptly came over and took my order (7oz. steak but with extra veggies instead of potatoes, but instead of taking the potatoes out entirely I had them added to my boyfriends order to go). Kudos to Tyler, our server, he waited on us and was great, as well as clean cut. I was by myself and he sat down with me at my table to take my order. It made it feel very personable. My water has been filled three times promptly when it's been emptied, but he knows not to ask questions when our mouths are full. Drink prices are a little high. When we sit in the bar area, I can see the fridge containing the wine bottles and I pay 7.99 for a glass of wine I happen to know is 4.99 for a bottle on the bottom shelf of my grocery store. Price on food is fair. I think 11.99 for steak, potatoes and veggies is pretty good. I do feel the AC is a notch too high but I always feel like that in any Applebees. Bring a sweater if you are a coldie.

I have ate at Applebee's many times inside and decided to order take out of one of my favorite sandwiches (the BLT). It was the WORST BLT EVER! First, it wasn't ready on time which is fine except it was SO COLD when I got home (I live about a mile from the restaurant). The cheese was definitely a Kraft single style, BARELY melted! Bacon was cold, bread was soggy. Fries were mediocre at best! I would have returned it but my family was all sick except me. Made myself something else! BLAH!

We sat in the bar and it was ok. I miss the old sauce that was actually hot for my wings. Normally when I sit in the bar my water never runs dry and I get served fast. I was on a 30min lunch break and got back after 40 mins. There was a troubled table near us but it seemed all the other tables in this severs section got water and attention. We even tried to flag her down before she went off to help another table. I like applebees and will try it again just hope for better service.

$3 Pounders and 1/2 price appetizers. Can't beat that happy hour. The food is as good as it gets in my opinion. I like the under 550 calorie options. The trio's are excellent as well. I actually don't remember a bad meal there. The service can be a little slow, but in their defense, it is busy most of the time. Rebekah, one of the servers is the best. She is very attentive and always has a smile on her face! Jacob is also very good!

Middle of the week 6:00pm. Decided that we were hungry enough to eat Applebees! Mistake. We did a togo order from the 2 for 20. I got the rib tips and fries.  Wife got chicken penne noodles. You get to choose a appetizer and a desert also. We went with bonless wings and cheese cake. The waitress was very nice. She made small talk with our kids in the truck. We waited around 30 mins and at first they brought out the wrong order to us. We paid the bill tipped 8bucks and drove off! When we got home found that the ribs were burnt and had very little sauce. My wife said hers was fine. Boneless wings were just soggy and flavorless. (Soggy maybe from togo box, understandable.) And dessert never made it into the bag. Been here several different times and been disapointed a lot. Fustrating. The waitress highlighted several things on our receipt to do a survey. I think before she takes the time to do that she should make sure that all the items have found there way into our bag. I will try my beat to stay clear of this chain. Not impressed by any means.

Eric was a great server! Very friendly and attentive!  Food was what you'd expect of an Applebees. We came in a little before 3 and were worried that we had missed their lunch menu, but were pleased to know we could still order off it. Only odd thing was it was a little quite for lunch time.

I've been to other Applebee's and never really enjoyed myself.  The food was boring, the decor was just average... nothing special.  But we went to this location on a whim.  OUTSTANDING!!  The food was delish!  The service was attentive but not nosy or pushy.  The restaurant was clean and busy.  The decor, fun and updated.  I'll definitely be going back to this location.

Needed to do a quick lunch on a Sunday. We told the waitress when we arrived that we would like to order right away, and she was very helpful in assisting with our order and expediting the meal, without ever seeming rushed.  She was very kind and quick to anticipate our needs. 30% tip for very quick service, and a good meal.

You've got to be kidding me. I was dragged here by a work friend "to try something new and closer to work". What an effing joke.  First, the hostess looked miserable. She walked like she was just really tired of the being an executioner; and with what they try to pass off as food here, I feel for her.  Second, even though the place was dead at prime lunch time, it took 10 minutes for the waitress to greet us and bring waters. I looked around and I'm pretty sure I counted more waitstaff than customers. Still, our waitress was MIA the entire lunch and I even had to "call waitress" on the table top computer thing just to get our check.  And finally, the menu and food. Look, it's lunch time. Why has Applebee's not created a real lunch menu? Instead of this you have two options: Their full dinner menu at full dinner prices, or their crappy "mix-n-match" lunch, which is extremely limited. I had their version of the clubhouse, which came with super sweet BBQ sauce and--no bacon??? It was slapped together with a level of care only possible at Applebee's. I had to dissect and reassemble it. I "matched" it with a Caesar salad that came un-tossed and was about 1/2 a handful of lettuce, at best. This with a 1/2 sandwich for $9.  I feel very comfortable saying that I will NEVER eat here again. I made that vow six years ago, yes--but this time I mean it.

This is not the type of restaurant I gravitate to but I fetched up here one day, hungry, and between appointments.  I am compelled to say that for $11 my lunch was darned good food and value, better, and more generous in portion, than in trendier joints that get gushy reviews.  And the waitstaff were really trying to do the job the way it ought to be done.

I'm on vacation here in Salem, I'm from California. The food was good but one thing I didn't understand. .. my steak wasn't cooked the way I wanted it and they took it back but brought my sides to me. Once my steak came back my sides were cold. They left my steak and took my sides to heat up. TIP!!! Take the whole plate and bring the meal all together. Don't get me wrong food was good just not a hot meal. :( my mom loved her burger! !!! Service was good too!

Just ordered a regular hamburger and some fruit. Fruit came in a hot bowl and must have been heated to thaw out the frozen strawberries, pineapple and apples... Hamburger was nothing special from this hamburger restaurant. Hoping to get something to eat from traveling through Oregon and staying at a local hotel, but not even this popular place could suffice my hunger craving.

My mom and I went to Applebee's to celebrate National Cheeseburger Day and were fortunate to have a great server, Michael J. He was perfect; laid back yet attentive. What I ordered doesn't qualify as a cheeseburger but the photo in the menu was so good, I had to try it: Brew Pub Philly!! Thinly sliced steak with American and craft beer cheese, piled high with batter fried jalapenos, peppers, and onions, all on a ciabatta roll. I could only finish 3/4 of it and I have to say it tasted just as good when I ate the rest at home.  Mom got an All Day Brunch Burger which reminded us both of a back-home favorite in Hawaii, the Loco Moco. It was cheeseburger enough for National Cheeseburger day; a thick ground beef patty with American cheese but with the astonishingly good tastes of fried egg, bacon, onions, hashbrowns and just enough ketchup, it became our new favorite! It was flavorful and will now be my new comfort food, for sure.  Thank you, Applebees, for a wonderful lunch with my mom!

I was pleasantly surprised when I ordered the Brisket Enchalada plate tonight . The overall presentation was eye pleasing. The Enchalada sauce was particularly flavorful although not traditional Mexican. But that didn't really matter all in all it was very flavorful meal. The size of the enchiladas could have possibly been a little bit larger but then again I did get three small ones and they were quit filling.  My wife tried the club sandwich and it was very good as well the  size of the sandwich was impressive and the homemade potato chips hot from the oven were especially tasty

We've come here now twice this year, and both times had the same great waiter.  Food is decent and prices are reasonable.  Sure their menu is a confusing mess, but once you sort it out it's not too bad.  On both visits it wasn't too busy during off-hours, which was nice.  They have a diverse selection of salads and mine have always been good.  Apps are plenty and all are tasty.  In the end, I won't ever give Applebees 5 stars, because you know, it's freaking Applebees.  BUT it could be way worse.

I Just come during happy hour.  3-6pm or 9pm-close They need more servers but food really is good.  Steaks are on point and always juicy. Drinks are good too. For happy hour pricing, but if I was to pay full price id go somewhere else haha :)
They were slammed and short-staffed, and we didn't order our take-out ahead of time, but they still prepared everything in a hurry, exactly to order. Very impressed!

I have ordered take out twice in a year and both times I was very disappointed.  A year ago my sister had surgery and when I got her home I ordered a pick up meal. Last week she had surgery and when I got her home and settled in I ordered. The steak was thick and tuff. The baked potato looked burnt and old. I tried slicing the steak down the center but there was so much fat it was impossible. Very dissatisfied with the food. .
Customer service has always been excellent. The food falls short at times- but there are great picks and some new ones worth trying. Based on the food - 3 stars.

The service was horrible. 10 min to order drinks, 15 to get said drinks, and then almost 20 for her to come back to take our order after watching her take the order of a couple seated a good 20 min after us. Will never recommend Applebee's. Ever.
So far the service is super slow the atmosphere is blah and our waitress is incompetent.

As we love them back home and thought we would try this one by our hotel. As much to say about this one? Very good. Our server was very nice and the food came out hot and great taste. Clean and good music playing. Tami was our server. Thumbs up great job.

Looking for some food in Salem on a weekday and it is well after 9pm. Where do you go? Applebee's.  At least that is where you go if you're not from Salem and hungry.  We have been to this particular location twice. The first time was the normal Applebee's experience. Unmemorable.  This time around was probably the best Applebee's experience that I have had in all my Applebee's dining experience, which is something I can count on one hand.  To begin with, it was clear when we arrived that our hostess and waiter seemed to have had a long night. The restaurant wasn't very full when we arrived so we probably just missed a big rush.  I imagine it was just one of those days for them. I get it. I've had those too. Despite this, they were nice and friendly.  The waiter was attentive and we even had the manager stopping by to say hello. That's the first time in my Applebee's dining experience that the manager stopped to do this.  The menu has a variety of food items for whatever you're feeling. Sandwiches. Steak. Chicken. Salad. Whatever. It's Applebee's.  If you expect more than that...well... I don't even know what to say then.  It's Applebee's, that should say it all, right?   At least I know that if I'm in Salem after 10pm and I'm hungry, I know where to get some decent grub.

Awful. Short pour on my beer (yeah on my beer, 3 inches from the top after I pay extra for the tall glass), my wife's 6.99 cocktail came out in a half empty glass, they charge an extra 1.99 for sweet potato fries with my burger and then put barely any on the plate, my wifes $12 piece of chicken was gross - like mechanically separated chicken scraps formed into a chicken breast shape. Very dissapointing,  I don't care what they do to this place, I'm never coming back.
Quick service, pick up available, car side as well, good happy hour specials.  Friendly staff, slows down when it is busy

My partner and I stopped in for a beverage and some snacks yesterday.  We were lucky enough to hit them during their Happy Hour with $3 beverages and half price appetizers.   Even though the Sampler Platter of appetizers was NOT on the selection we went with it anyway because after doing the math, it would have cost us more to get the three appetizers we wanted even at half price, and we would have had too much food.  I suggest that they should add their Sampler Platter to the appetizer menu anyway because they serve less food and still make a profit. Being Summer (or at least that is what the calendar says) I opted for a frozen LEMONADOES drink.  Yes, that is NOT a misspelling...for some reason these chain restaurants try to spell words with cutesy twists.  My partner went tried and true with a Hefeweizen. Total cost for the two drinks and appetizer platter was just over $18.00. While I still don't recommend Applebee's for a full dinner, drinks and a few nibbles is a good bet.

Went in for lunch, planned on having dessert but our waitress brought us the bill with out asking if we wanted any. She lost out on a sale and therefore better tip. My food was very good. I will be back, just remember wait staff, always try to up sell, it may mean a bigger tip for you.

I came in late last night and I had a blast! My friend Cory I have known for over 8 years is the GM here.  They restaurant just had a renovation done and it looks amazing inside! Come check it out! Try the chicken and Strimp.

Will defenatly be going back to here. Lunch prices were very good. Took very little time for the food to arive. I ordered the lunch combo and my wife had a salad. My combo was great but my wife thought the salad was to spicy. The staff was amazing, my wife let the server know about the salad and the manager came out and apologized about the salad and even gave us a $10 gift card to come back. Will come back and defenatky gonna tell everyone about the great service.

Well I set myself up for this one by thinking maybe I could actually get some good food here for once. I was wrong. The staff was friendly this time although I felt like the manager approached us too often.. Maybe that's just because I was trying to eat. I got the happy hour 1/2 special.. My boyfriend and I shared the boneless wings which were only like half covered in the sauce. One even only had some on the tip. I got the cheeseburger sliders, which came out very pink..... How hard is it to fully cook a hamburger that small? I asked for them to make me new ones but get them to go, they were nice and apologetic. When I got my to go bag we left and went home. I was starving so I sat down to eat at home and my little cheeseburger sliders were again, not thoroughly cook. I know I said this in my last review but I won't eat here again even if they pay me. No matter what, I will not be dragged into it again.
Day after Halloween trick no treat!!!.9.49 for a plate on nachos with barely any meat or cheese.the only flavoring on these chips was the meat juice. BOO HISS!

SERVER  CASSANDRA was PMS-ING AT ASIANS... at least that's how I felt. Your server thanks a white family for coming in.. then hugs another white person.. helps another white family (while your request get IGNORED,1 refill and 1 shooter both asked at the SAME TIME) and then sees you and frown and has insincere apology. It is upsetting that a refill, just one, the only one we ever asked for comes after 15 minutes and it is wrong, and then 20 mins the shooter comes (half melted)... Those two things a server can prepare, it isnt even the kitchen's fault, if it is the food coming at different times I can understand.  Asians tip bad? If that was what the server thought, well she is stupid.  I am not uneducated nor uncivilized. After her bad treatment I left 10% instead of 18%. The worst part is she has been a server for 8 years! Let me repeat EIGHT (8) years but no customer service skills? Honestly the door holder/opener was a lot nicer. Honestly I go there for the food, but when a bad service affects the food it is an issue. I mean if she is being racist, that's even a bigger issue, and I feel that was it. We were dressed nice but not like in suits, our clothing had no stain or holes, and me and my mom carried a designer purse, its not like we LOOKED like hobos.  why 2 stars? The manager acknowledged the issue when I called him. He gave us a refund which I was surprised since I only called because I felt that treating someone that way was not okay.  ONLY CONCERN: since I will get a refund, I am afraid the waitress might have my address and go revenge on me or something. Remember: worst server: Cassandra best server: Jason
We had an early dinner at this property and the food was very good and the service was outstanding.  We will be back to visit and and would recommend this property to all my friends.
Amazing service and karaoke is awesome! RC is the man!
Half price appetizers are a cheap solution for dinner. Wonton tacos are an interesting combination. This place was mobbed for a Wednesday night.

Applebee's is all over the place in Salem, there are several locations, but none are more needed than this Lancaster location as restaurants are spread out far and apart. While the parking is cramped, it is likely to stay that way all throughout the afternoon all the way into dinner. From a food standpoint, this Applebee's has been fairly decent, although consistent with the rest of its sister chains. Service has always been your average teenager / young adult taking orders and maintaining the service. One should go here before 4PM to take advantage of their half-off appetizers special on weekdays.

This Salem Applebee's location is the best I have been too. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The food always comes exactly as ordered, no matter what substitutions you ask for, and always tastes good.
I enjoyed cheap drinks, good food, and fun times with friends here on a monthly basis while in college.
